paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Ptychoderes magnus Mermudes and Napp, 2004: 27
, Figs. 1, 3 ;
Rheinheimer, 2004: 10
(cat.).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ptychoderes magnus
was recently described and illustrated by Mermudes and Napp (2004) . Here, the descriptions of the male and female terminalia are added.

Female terminalia. Similar to that of
P. jordani
, differing by the emarginate apex of both tergite and sternite VIII.

Male holotype : BRAZIL ,
Rondônia
, Ouro Preto d’Oeste,
X.1986
, O. Roppa , P. Magno , J. Becker leg. ( MNRJ ). Paratypes . BRAZIL .
Rondônia
: Ariquemes , 1 F,
XI
.1979, B. Silva leg. ( MNRJ ); Ouro Preto d’Oeste , 4 M, 2 F
,
X.1986
, O. Roppa , P. Magno , J. Becker leg. ( MNRJ ), 1 M, idem ( CPMT ), 1 M, idem ( DZUP ).
Amapá
: Macapá ( Fazendinha IEPA , Parque. Zoob. ), 1 F
,

, P. Magno leg. ( MNRJ ).

: ( Faz. E steio ZF­3, 60 Km N. de Manaus , Km 23), 1 F
,

, B. C. Klein leg. (in Malaise Reserva 1112) ( INPA ); Manaus , 1 F
, 16.IX.1955 , 1 F,

Mato Grosso
: Sinop ( Faz. Teles ), 1 F
,

), 2 F
,

II
.1964, A. Martinez leg. (MACN).

Remarks See remarks under
P. obsoletus
.

Distribution ( Fig. 265 )
BRAZIL ( Amapá , Rondônia , Amazonas, Pará and Mato Grosso ) and BOLIVIA .
